messages.title: Liz is a fulltime MP working for you.
messages.content: It's been an honour and a privilege to represent you in Parliament. Since I was elected in October it’s been a busy time for me, but it’s been a pleasure to meet so many of you in your workplaces, in schools, shops and on your doorsteps.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A strong economic foundation; balance the books; work with local employers and businesses to bring high-quality jobs to the area; stand up for everyone's job security, rights at work, and the NHS.
Higher living standards for working families; freeze energy bills until 2017; provide starter homes at 20% below the regular price.
An NHS with the time to care; deliver 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs; guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests within one week.

Controls on immigration; people who come here won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years and have to contribute before taking out; introduce fair rules making it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers.
A country where the next generation can do better than the last; tuition fees reduced to £6,000; improve teacher standards and guarantee every teacher has a degree.

issues.economy: A strong economic foundation; balance the books; work with local employers and businesses to bring high-quality jobs to the area.
issues.education: Tuition fees reduced to £6,000; improve teacher standards and guarantee every teacher has a degree.
issues.health: An NHS with the time to care; 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs; GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests within one week.
issues.immigration: Controls on immigration; people who come here won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years and have to contribute before taking out.

contactInformation.address: Labour Office, Suite 5, Sufficient House, Middleton Gardens, Middleton M24 4EL

images.caption: Liz McInnes Labour candidate for Heywood and Middleton
